content.description: Sit start on the uphill side of the Boulder. Both hands on slopey side-pull type features. Move up using great pockets and edges. Fun movement, easy top out, also serves as the most logical down climb or way off the block.I have been informed This is definitely not an FA. I have reached out to the FAist for name/grade info and will update when available.
content.location: On the North side (uphill side) of the MorelÂ Boulder, the first Boulder you reach of the clear cut boulders.

content.description: Squat start low as possible on the west side of the morel. I used a left hand undercling pocket and a right hand side pull below the arete. A few fun moves. If only it lasted longer!I assigned a temporary name until I hear back. I have reached out to the FAist for name/grade beta and will update when available.
content.location: The west side of the morel boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the slab side, traverse about 270 degrees counter clockwise around the morel, and top out via the pedestal feature. Fun and challenging.
content.location: Start on the slab side of the Morel boulder.

content.description: Small blob of a boulder, generally the first block you will approach on the trail when in the main bouldering area.
